Package org.opengrok.indexer.util

Interface BlockingObjectPool<T>

  • Type Parameters:
    T - the type of objects to pool.
    All Superinterfaces:
    ObjectPool<T>
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    BoundedBlockingObjectPool
    public interface BlockingObjectPool<T>
extends ObjectPool<T>
    Represents an API for a pool of objects that makes the requesting threads wait if no object is available.
    Author:
    Swaranga

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      T get​(long time, TimeUnit unit)
      Returns an instance of type T from the pool, waiting up to the specified wait time if necessary for an object to become available..

      • Methods inherited from interface org.opengrok.indexer.util.ObjectPool

        get, release, shutdown

    • Method Detail

      • get

        T get​(long time,
      TimeUnit unit)
throws InterruptedException
        Returns an instance of type T from the pool, waiting up to the specified wait time if necessary for an object to become available..

        The call is a blocking call, and client threads are made to wait for time until an object is available or until the timeout occurs. The call implements a fairness algorithm that ensures that an FCFS service is implemented.

        Clients are advised to react to InterruptedException. If the thread is interrupted while waiting for an object to become available, most implementations set the interrupted state of the thread to true and returns null. However this is subject to change from implementation to implementation.

        Parameters:
        time - amount of time to wait before giving up, in units of unit
        unit - a TimeUnit determining how to interpret the timeout parameter
        Returns:
        T an instance of the Object of type T from the pool.
        Throws:
        InterruptedException - if interrupted while waiting
